Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from six fragments) of North Ionia black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed save for band near lip; two added bands of white-red-white; exterior, cream slip; tongues at rim, every fourth or fifth red; handle floral to left in frieze below; to right, lion with raised paw attacking a goat grazing to left; below, zigzag between dividing bands with superimposed white-red-white band; part of probable lotus bud and flower band at lower break.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.234)
